That's a great idea! Asking your friends to share your fundraising page on social media can help you reach a wider audience and potentially attract new donors. Since they've already shown their support for your charitable efforts by participating in the Cycle for a Cause bike ride with you, they'll likely be happy to help spread the word about your Run for the Cure fundraising campaign.

Here are some tips to make the most out of their social media shares:

**Make it easy to share**: Provide a direct link to your fundraising page and suggest a simple message they can share on social media, such as:

"Support my friend [Your Name] as they run for a cure! 🏃‍♀️💕 Donate or share their fundraising page to help raise money for breast cancer research: [link to fundraising page]"

**Use relevant hashtags**: Encourage your friends to use relevant hashtags, such as #RunForTheCure, #BreastCancerResearch, #CharityRun, or #FundraisingForACure, to make the post more discoverable.

**Ask them to tag you**: Request that your friends tag you in their social media post so you can see who's sharing your fundraising page and thank them personally.

**Example Message**:

"Hey friends! 👋 I hope you're all doing well. I wanted to ask a favor - could you please share my fundraising page for the Run for the Cure event on May 15th? 🏃‍♀️💕 I'm trying to raise money for breast cancer research, and every share counts! You can use this message: 'Support my friend [Your Name] as they run for a cure! 🏃‍♀️💕 Donate or share their fundraising page to help raise money for breast cancer research: [link to fundraising page]' Don't forget to tag me so I can see your post and thank you personally! ❤️ Thanks in advance for your help!"

**Tips for Encouraging Social Media Shares**:

* Make sure your fundraising page is up-to-date and easy to navigate.
* Provide clear instructions on how to share your page and what message to use.
* Express your gratitude to your friends for their help and support.
* Consider offering a small incentive, such as a social media shoutout or a thank-you note, for those who share your page.

By asking your friends to share your fundraising page on social media, you're not only getting the word out about your Run for the Cure fundraising campaign but also showing your appreciation for their support and friendship. Good luck, and I hope you get lots of shares and donations!
